metadata.feature_description: Create and edit rich HTML content using a WYSIWYG editor with inline editing capabilities

steps.action: Navigate to home page and enter Edit mode
steps.expected: Edit mode is activated with module edit controls visible
steps.actual: Edit mode activated successfully, module controls and 'Add Existing Module' links visible

steps.action: Click on empty HTML module to open inline editor
steps.expected: Inline editor opens for content entry
steps.actual: Inline editor opened with formatting toolbar visible

steps.action: Type test content 'Test Content Creation - Testing HTML Module'
steps.expected: Text appears in the editor
steps.actual: Text successfully typed into the inline editor

steps.action: Click on existing HTML module content in Edit mode
steps.expected: Inline editor opens with existing content
steps.actual: Inline editor opened showing existing content ready for editing

steps.action: Modify content and click outside editor
steps.expected: Content is auto-saved
steps.actual: Content was automatically saved when clicking outside editor

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Edit content in separate edit page

steps.action: Navigate to Edit Content page via URL (ctl/Edit/mid/960)
steps.expected: Separate Edit Content page opens with full CKEditor
steps.actual: Edit Content page loaded with full CKEditor Rich Text Editor

steps.action: View CKEditor toolbar and content area
steps.expected: Full WYSIWYG editor with all formatting tools visible
steps.actual: CKEditor displayed with Document, Clipboard, Editing, Paragraph, Links, Insert, Styles, and Colors toolbars

steps.action: Select text and apply Bold formatting using toolbar button
steps.expected: Text becomes bold
steps.actual: Bold formatting applied successfully, text displays in bold

steps.action: Verify Bold button state in toolbar
steps.expected: Bold button shows pressed/active state
steps.actual: Bold button displayed as pressed in CKEditor toolbar

steps.action: Click Image button in CKEditor toolbar
steps.expected: Image Properties dialog opens
steps.actual: Image Properties dialog opened with tabs for Image Info, Link, Upload, Advanced

steps.action: Click Browse Server button
steps.expected: File browser opens showing server images
steps.actual: File Browser opened in new tab showing folder tree and available images

steps.action: Select cavalier-logo.png image and click OK
steps.expected: Image URL is populated in dialog
steps.actual: Image URL populated with /Portals/0/cavalier-logo.png, Width: 225, Height: 60

steps.action: Click OK to insert image into editor
steps.expected: Image appears in editor content
steps.actual: CAVALIER logo image inserted into editor along with existing text

steps.action: Select text in inline editor
steps.expected: Text is selected and formatting toolbar appears
steps.actual: Text selected and inline toolbar displayed with Bold, Italic, formatting options

steps.action: Apply Bold formatting
steps.expected: Selected text becomes bold
steps.actual: Text formatted as bold, visible in saved content

steps.action: Click Discard button in edit bar
steps.expected: Confirmation dialog appears
steps.actual: Discard confirmation dialog appeared with message 'Are you sure you want to discard the changes?'

steps.action: Click Cancel button on confirmation dialog
steps.expected: Dialog closes and content is preserved
steps.actual: Dialog closed and content remained intact on the page

steps.action: Edit content in inline editor and click outside
steps.expected: Content is auto-saved
steps.actual: Content auto-saved via AJAX call to HtmlPro/HtmlTextPro/Save endpoint

steps.action: Verify saved content displays correctly on page
steps.expected: Content with formatting is visible
steps.actual: Content displayed with bold formatting in module 960

steps.action: Click Save and Close on Edit Content page
steps.expected: Content is saved and page returns to view mode
steps.actual: Content saved successfully and redirected to home page

observations: The inline WYSIWYG editor supports auto-save functionality every 5 seconds via AJAX
CKEditor 4 is used as the Rich Text Editor with comprehensive formatting options
The file browser supports multiple folder structures and URL type selection (Relative/Absolute)
XSS protection is properly implemented - script tags in page names are HTML-escaped in navigation
The system maintains draft/publish workflow with Discard and Publish buttons in the edit bar
Image insertion includes width/height auto-detection and aspect ratio locking
